{{National football association | | Logo = <!-- Do NOT place a non-free image here without complying with WP:NFCC #10c -->|| | Founded = 1938 | | FIFA affiliation = 1994 | | UEFA affiliation = 1993 | | Region = [[UEFA]] | | Region affiliation = 1993 | | President = JÃ¡n KovÃ¡Äik | | Coach = [[VladimÃ­r Weiss (footballer born 1964)|VladimÃ­r Weiss]]| }} The '''Slovak Football Association''' ('''SFZ''') ({{lang-sk|SlovenskÃ½ futbalovÃ½ zvÃ¤z;}} '''SFZ''') is the governing body of [[football (soccer)|football]] in [[Slovakia]]. It organises the Slovak football league (top division: [[CorgoÅ Liga]]) and the [[Slovakia national football team]]. It is based in [[Bratislava]]. It originally became a member of [[FIFA]] in 1907, but disbanded after [[World War II]] because [[Czech Republic|Czech]] and [[Slovakia|Slovak]] football competitions combined, and so did the national teams. It became a member again in 1994, one year after the breakup of [[Czechoslovakia]].
